The document describes various Panda3D configuration settings, including window properties, collision detection optimizations, and file handling. The chunk discusses the `flatten-geoms` setting, which controls how NodePath flattening combines Geoms for efficiency in collision tests, and the `flt-error-abort` setting, which triggers an assertion on errors reading or writing FLTD files. This context is relevant to understanding performance optimization in 3D rendering and debugging file operations in Panda3D.

since collision tests rely heavily on bounding volume tests to be
efficient, and combining CollisionNodes is likely to merge bounding
volumes inappropriately. flatten-geoms bool 1 When this is true (the default), NodePath::flatten_strong() and
flatten_medium() will attempt to combine multiple Geoms into as few
Geoms as possible, by combing GeomVertexDatas and then unifying. Setting
this false disables this behavior, so that NodePath flatten operations
will only reduce nodes. This affects only the NodePath interfaces; you
may still make the lower-level SceneGraphReducer calls directly. flt-error-abort bool 0 Set this true to trigger an assertion failure (and core dump)
immediately when an error is detected on reading or writing a flt file.
